author: Hatching

commands.description: Get a list of all samples either private or public
commands.name: triage-query-samples

commands.description: Submits a file or url for analysis
commands.name: triage-submit-sample

commands.description: Pulls back basic information about the sample id given
commands.name: triage-get-sample

commands.description: Gets a summary report of the sample id provided
commands.name: triage-get-sample-summary

commands.description: Deletes a sample from the sandbox
commands.name: triage-delete-sample

commands.description: When a sample is in the static_analysis status, a profile should be selected in order to continue.
commands.name: triage-set-sample-profile

commands.description: Get the static analysis of a sample
commands.name: triage-get-static-report

commands.description: Retrieves the generated Triage behavioral report for a single task
commands.name: triage-get-report-triage

commands.description: Retrieves the output of the kernel monitor
commands.name: triage-get-kernel-monitor

commands.description: Retrieves the PCAP of the analysis for further manual analysis
commands.name: triage-get-pcap

commands.description: Retrieves files dumped by the sample. The names can be found under the "dumped" section from the triage report output
commands.name: triage-get-dumped-file

commands.description: Return all users within the company as a paginated list. Returns a single user if a userID is provided
commands.name: triage-get-users

commands.description: Creates a new user and returns it. The user will become a member of the company the requesting user is a member of
commands.name: triage-create-user

commands.description: Delete a user and all associated data, invalidating any sessions and removing their API keys. Any samples submitted by this user are kept
commands.name: triage-delete-user

commands.description: Creates a new key can be used to make API calls on behalf of the specified user. The user should have been granted the access_api permission beforehand
commands.name: triage-create-api-key

commands.description: Lists all API keys that the user has.
commands.name: triage-get-api-key

commands.description: Delete the user's API key with the specified name
commands.name: triage-delete-api-key

commands.description: List all profiles that your company has
commands.name: triage-get-profiles

commands.description: Create a new profile
commands.name: triage-create-profile

commands.description: Update an existing profile
commands.name: triage-update-profile

commands.description: Get a list of private and public samples matching the search query
commands.name: triage-query-search

commands.description: Update the profile with the specified ID or name. The stored profile is overwritten, so it is important that the submitted profile has all fields, with the exception of the ID
commands.name: triage-delete-profile

integration.description: Submit a high volume of samples to run in a sandbox and view reports
integration.name: Hatching Triage (Partner Contribution)

name: Hatching Triage
readme:
### Hatching Triage
===============

Hatching (https://hatching.io/) Triage (https://tria.ge/) is a highly scalable
automated malware analysis sandbox supporting Windows, Android, Linux, and
macOS analysis.

Sign up for free at https://tria.ge/ or reach out to us at support@hatching.io
for more information!

Also make sure to read our blog over at https://hatching.io/blog and to follow
us on twitter for the latest malware insights https://twitter.com/hatching_io.
